ygData.subject: Re: Prenatal Wizard
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Yet. ... Are you saying there is something wrong with this, or that Enchanters have more? ... Ditto. ... Incorrect. Wizard s DD spells are the best at any
ygData.messageBody:
Robert Spelman wrote:
>
> From: Robert Spelman <madoc_ab_owain@...>

> Let me explain - Verant hasn't implemented specialization skills or the
> alternate planes,

Yet.


> we have almost nothing for armor or hitpoints,

Are you saying there is something wrong with this, or that Enchanters
have more?

> our melee
> skills are pathetic

Ditto.

> and our powers don't become greater than other classes
> until 40-somethingth level.

Incorrect. Wizard's DD spells are the best at any given level.


> Plus, the single greatest way of leveling up -
> killing har red mobs - is unavailable to us, because our spells are often
> resisted completely by these creatures. So, instead of grouping with
> powerful warriors to beat up on mobs that will actually give EVERYONE in the
> group decent experience, we're relegated to trying to solo weak blues or
> fight white and yellow creatures in a group for pitiful experience because
> WE CAN'T TOUCH HARD MOBS LIKE EVERY OTHER CLASS CAN!
>

Totally FALSE! All spells are resisted when they are cast on creatures
that are more than 5 levels higher than you. Enchanter's and Magician's
too. And cleric's and shaman's too.

You can cause damage to mobs that are not more than 5 levels higher than
you, it's very simple. As far as colors - 4 levels above your should be
red. So you CAN fight Reds. And don't forget that the melee classes will
miss so much and be hit so hard that it is not very profitable for them
to go against high reds as well.

> I've watched every group I've run with pass me up in level. I've watched
> characters started while I was at level 12 PASS ME at level 13. It's not as
> though I never play, it's just that I CANNOT GAIN MORE THAN HALF A BUBBLE
> EXP PER HOUR, on average. That's powergaming, soloing in the Karanas vs.
> blue beetles and the occasional white/yellow.
>

No offense, but maybe you're just not that good. Yes, there is the
chance that you make wrong choices or get stuck in bad groups. As I
said, a bubble an hour is possible. And the Karanas are a really bad
place for a level 12-16 alone. Especially wizard.

Your anecdotal case is not viable as an argument as to the Wizard's
capabilities.

> Needless to say, I'm very frustrated in playing this class right now. The
> only reason I remain a Wizard is stubbornness. Everyone says it gets better
> at higher levels, but the fact of the matter is that we'll always be a
> second-rate class unless Verant fixes specialization, plane travel and
> spell-resistances of higher-level mobs.
>

You have doubts that specialization and the planes will be fixed?

--
Qenelin
